did.abstract: Letters to Hayes recommending various persons for appointment for office. One letter of the Rev. Dr. James Freeman Clarke, a Unitarian minister of Boston, concerns General H.S. Huidekoper. Other writers are John Tyler Morgan, Benjamin Franklin Perry, John Lee Chapman, and William Wade Dudley. A letter from John Sherman concerns a bill for the relief of William H. Thompson, a collector of interal revenue in North Carolina. There is also on brief note of introduction from Hayes for a friend.
